questions.question: What is the Hall coefficient in the Hall effect experiment?

answers.a: The ratio of Hall voltage to magnetic field strength
answers.b: The ratio of Hall voltage to current passing through the conductor
answers.c: The ratio of charge carrier density to conductor's length
answers.d: The ratio of Hall voltage to temperature

questions.question: In the Hall effect experiment, if the direction of the magnetic field is changed while keeping other parameters constant, what will happen to the Hall voltage?

answers.a: The magnitude of the Hall voltage as well as the direction of the Hall voltage remains the same.
answers.c: The magnitude of the Hall voltage remains the same, but the direction of the Hall voltage reverses.
answers.d: The Hall voltage will fluctuate randomly.

questions.question: During the Hall effect experiment, if the current passing through the conductor is increased, what effect will it have on the Hall voltage?

answers.c: The Hall voltage will remain the same.
answers.d: The Hall voltage will become zero.

questions.question: If the magnetic field is turned off during the Hall effect experiment while keeping other parameters unchanged, what will happen to the Hall voltage?

answers.c: The Hall voltage will remain the same.
answers.d: The Hall voltage will become zero.

questions.question: During the Hall effect experiment, if the temperature of the conductor is increased, what effect will it have on the Hall voltage?

answers.c: The Hall voltage will remain the same.
answers.d: The Hall voltage will become zero.
